text: Daniel Keyes (August 9, 1927 - June 15, 2014) was an American author. He was well known for his Hugo award-winning short story and Nebula award-winning novel Flowers for Algernon. Keyes was given the Author Emeritus honor by the Science Fiction and Fantasy Writers of America in 2000. Keyes died of pneumonia in Boca Raton, Florida, aged 86. ==References== Category:1927 births Category:2014 deaths Category:American novelists Category:Deaths from pneumonia Category:Infectious disease deaths in Florida Category:Writers from New York City
title: Daniel Keyes
